entry.title: Take a Step Back to DVDs
entry.summary: It is time for a digital detox! Imagine a world where we aren't bound to the whims of a streaming service or digital store; a world where our media is really ours, not just a license to be taken away at the whim of these…
entry.content:
It is time for a digital detox! 

Imagine a world where we aren't bound to the whims of a streaming service or digital store; a world where our media is really ours, not just a license to be taken away at the whim of these services! Help me take back ownership of the games and movies we pay for!

Disclaimer

This is gonna be a heavy opinion based post with facts within the article, please understand there is nothing wrong with disagreeing.

Why?

It is my opinion that we as a community should attempt a digital detox from digital media services when we can and opt into physical methods. I am writing this call to action to reduce digital media and to reduce subscription based content. Let us go back to owning a copy, owning our media, to where no one can take it away.

What is right with digital?

I will not be the first to say, that digital media is convenient, you don't have to worry about the disk, cartridge, or whatever Nintendo may call it. So long as you remember your login information you don't need to worry about losing your game/movies through hardware problems like water, scratches, or anything else of that nature. This is because these streaming and gaming services have backups for backups so that you may be able to have access to games that they allow you to have. This also saves on space with the clunky physical media. Before people would have bookshelves with games/movies, but now not so much. 

What is wrong with digital?

In most cases, the service that is holding onto your digital media can decide to close down or remove that single piece of media removing your ability to access it again. I feel like the idea of us buying the product but then always having the risk of this product being taken away just because the distribution service is like, "na, you're not having it anymore".

Small Exceptions

There is a very rare case where even if the media is removed from the store, you can still redownload it as many times as you wish, with that rare case being steampowered.com. GOG.com is another digital media source that also allows you to download and redownload the game if it's removed from their site, the main difference between steam and GOG is that if steam disappears, your games are gone. If GOG disappears your installer still works so long as you have the offline installer.

Tho I don't agree with digital media, steam is doing it somewhat right with GOG having future proof the issue.

It forces users to potentially pay more

Subscription based services have been in play for a long time and are not new. However, there are 200+ subscription based services for movies and TV shows alone. For the common services (Disney, Netflix, and Amazon) for the "with ads" service you are paying a total of 26.97$ a month just to watch what you want to watch. Tho this may be cheap, keep in mind that once you no longer wish to pay for a subscription, you no longer have access to this media.

I have searched for TV shows like Summer Camp Island, Wolfboy and the Anything Factory, and The Dragon Prince. All of these are streaming services exclusive OR bootleg purchasable. With one no longer available in the US anymore. Personally, I want to support my movie and TV show creators but not as much as these subscription services that are more than willing to just say, "No more of this content". 

But wait...

Before you say it, I understand that if Netflix comes out with their Netflix original and has a DVD version that I am still supporting Netflix. however the idea that I outright buying physical media over paying for their subscription service shows my stance and what I like.

A New Issue Arises

Nintendo officially confirmed on April 2, 2025, that the Switch 2 cartridge will only contain authorization codes for the game, and not the game itself. This is very shaky grounds on what ownership you really have. Originally you owned the game and were able to share it without monetary gain, then turned into you own a license of a game with restrictions as per the licensing agreement, and now with the new setup for Nintendo, you are renting the game now and will lose rights to them if/when they deem it necessary.

Do What You Can

I noted that we should attempt to remove these services from our lives. However, I myself understand that its very difficult to just stop all of these services. They are everywhere and in no hurry to stop. So what I want to do is avoid it if you can. Go for DVDs, Go for Disk games, Go for GOG and download offline! Do what you can, and if you cant, let it be known that your not happy with subscription based services!

THIS IS NOT A CALL TO PIRATE

Pirating has its place, but this is not one of them. I want you to support creators and I want you to pay for these games. What this is a call for is a call to avoid digital services when you can.

My Opinion

As the title suggests, I want us all to take a step back and go back to DVDs, CDs, cartages even offline digital downloads. It may be clunky but at the same time, this is the only true way to have your game and keep it too.

entry.content:
Disclaimer

1. I am disregarding my religious background when reviewing this series. 

2. I am disregarding my political background when reviewing this series.

3. some spoilers are to be expected

4. this review is only in the context of all the episodes up to season 2 episode 12 and the 4 shorts listed within the helluva boss playlist, totaling 24 videos to watch. New reviews will come out as new episodes come out!

Helluva Boss 

The show is about 3 imps and a hellhound: Blitzo (the o is silent), Moxxie, Millie, and Loona! Blitzo got tired of being a basic nobody and decided to start his own business. "what is his business?" you might ask, hunting down and killing in any specified way that dammed souls may request/demand, and who do he and his business partners hunt? Humans on Earth!

How Does Blitzo Get To Earth?

Blitzo does a transaction, for lack of better words, with a powerful demon known as an ars goetia named Stolas. Stolas has a book with magical powers to open portals to the "human world." Through this book, he is meant to study the stars and understand prophecies. However, through some "favors," Stolas is willing to give up his sacred book at risk of great punishment.

Anything Else You Should Know?

In almost every episode there can be bloody bodies, some form of killing, swearing, and a LOT of sexual jokes. They even show (tho blurred) dildos in 2 of the episodes. This series is very crude, more so than Hazbin Hotel, so be warned. 

The Good

This series is actually hilarious. The writing is well done (to a point and I will get to that), the characters are loveable, and, in a lot of aspects, are relatable when it comes to their emotional issues. When watching the series you get to grow with and watch the characters progress in their emotional state, from the petty drama between Blitzo and Moxxie to the romantic married couple between Moxxie and Milly. 

The Bad

Right around late season 2, the story got shaky, facing similar issues as to Hazbin Hotel. Mostly with the questionable pacing of the characters' emotional status. It is apparent that since the 2nd episode, Stolas did not have a good relationship with his daughter due to family issues. However, in the later episode of season 2, we have a major falling out that is caused by questionable reasons and felt very forced. A few other events took place as well which also feels like context is missing or out of order, more info on that in my in-depth post (to be added).

I think one of the major flaws with this storyline is that at many points that it feel rushed. It’s not nearly as bad as Hazbin Hotel, you start to notice it in episodes like season 1 episode 6 truth seekers. by no means a bad episode, but it felt like the flow could of been smoother as it felt like bits of the story were taken out due to keeping it within the appropriate time limit.

Lastly, we have very little Milly growth, now the writers tried to combat that with showing story about her and her family, but even then Milly feels like a flat character, for being one of the major characters in the series she has less growth then the "I say, I say!" salesmen.

The Rating 

So of all the harshness I gave, this series is unmatched when compared to many other indie series or even standard TV shows, I hope the writing gets better and this is just time constrained issue that we will not have in the future. As it sits right now, I am giving this series a 7/10. A major step above Hazbin, as it has incredible music and pretty good writing for most of the story. All the music is amazingly placed and works well with the story. I just hope that season 3 does not fall into the same pit holes as Hazbin Hotel.

entry.content:
What Are MOBA Games?

If you already know what MOBA games are, you can skip this whole post.

Game Function 

Multiplayer Online Battle Arena! In this game format, players are split between 2 teams in multiple lanes, commonly 3. The goal in these MOBA games is to "kill the keep." You have 5 players on each team with unlimited lives. However, if you die, you need to wait until you revive. As the game goes on, the timer gets longer and longer. Each game is limited to its own session; the last game session will not be transferred to the next game session.

Shops and Items

You also have a shop to get items and in turn get more stats. These stats can make or break your game so you best get items that suit character.

"But how would you pay for these items?" You might ask; well by killing the enemy's troops/players/buildings, and you also obtain gold passively.

Items and their stats vary from game to game, deadlock has items that can modify your weapon's reload whereas League of Legends will not have such items.

What is the goal of these games?

You need to move into the enemy's base and destroy their keep, however, in most of these games, you will have to deal with enemy creatures known as minions, towers, and some form of buffing building!

Minions: The minions are simple creatures that are mainly there for you to earn gold once you kill them, they do a small amount of damage, but be careful, if you aggro too many of them then even a hero can't defend against them.

Towers: The towers are more of an equalizer able to destroy the minions quickly, but the tower does not share the gold with you in most cases. The tower does serve as a protector, if you attack an enemy hero under their tower then you will be targeted, so be mindful of that. You have to kill each tower within that lane to enter into the enemy's base.

Buffing Buildings: In the enemy's base, you have a buffing building that, once destroyed, can buff your ally minions. The buffs differ greatly per game but they are invaluable for your team! These buildings generally have no protection except for other players or minions. These buildings also serve an additional purpose, they are the main requirement to destroy before you can touch the keep.

Keep: The Keep is the main building that you need to destroy, but unless you destroy most of the buildings above, you can't even touch the Keep. Most players tend to get items and multiple minions with them to destroy these keeps because they tend to have a defense system of some sort, generally following the same rules as towers.

Why Are MOBAs So Popular?

These games tend to be fast-paced and requires a lot of teamwork and skill. People find these games enjoyable because of the competitiveness of the game, and the fact that the game is limitless. There is no endgame with each match not transferring over to the next. The main appeal of this game is the number of characters you can play, the number of builds you can go with each character, and the fact that you will play with different people the next time you play again.

Who are these games not for?

Solo players, and people who want to see progress. These games are amazing in the moment matches and give little to no thought to long term progression. If you are someone wanting to see a skill, a number, a quest, or anything go up, MOBA games are not for you. If you are wanting a semi-quick game then this is it!

What MOBA games are out there?

Traditional MOBA games tend to have a top down perspective like League of Legends or DOTA 2 is another good one, then you have some non traditional MOBA games like Deadlock and SMITE who have a 3rd person perspective. a full list will be provided and maintained when reviews for these games are made.

entry.content:
Disclaimer

1. I am disregarding my religious background when reviewing this series. 

2. I am disregarding my political background when reviewing this series.

3. some spoilers are to be expected.

4. this review is only in the context of all the episodes up to season 1 episode 8 within the hazbin hotel episodes list. New episodes/season reviews will be added as the episodes come out.

Hazbin Hotel

The show is about the princess of hell, Charlie, and how she wishes the best for her people, her people being the sinners from Earth. However due to claimed overpopulation reasons, heaven sends down an elite squad of angels to reduce the population of the sinners, before you ask, these angels use special weapons that destroy the soul making you cease to exist. Throughout the show we see Charlie pleading with heaven to put a halt to the killing of her people and instead provide a way to redeem themselves and enter into heaven. 

The Good

The story gives sort of adult Disney vibes, something you should not show your kids but a 16-year-old would enjoy. There is fun music and enjoyable characters. I wish to say more but that is about it.

The Bad

Don't get me wrong, the story is an interesting idea and could be an amazing hit, and to a large fan base, it is a huge hit. But each time I rewatched this series I found more and more wrong with this story.

From simple continuity issues to questionable pacing, It feels like Hazbin Hotel struggles a fair bit with script writing errors.

Continuity issues

When Charlie has get her meeting in heaven she let the line "fuck yes" slip out, followed by people in heaven giving Charlie a sour look as if that word is not allowed. However, before and after the scene we have multiple people saying "fuck" in many parts of the episode. This is something I did over look in my original watch through, but then noticed on my 2nd run.

Questionable Pacing

An example of what I would call questionable pacing would be when VOX, the TV demon, finds out that Alister, the radio demon, is back. In the scene VOX is talking to one of the other demons he works with about an unrelated subject then the demon mentions how "the radio demon" is back in town. VOX responds with anger asking why the other demon did not say that first, the song did not start until after a few seconds of already knowing that Alister is back, VOX says again in a more angry tone "That Fucker is back" to kick off the song. 

Don't get me wrong, the song is a masterpiece, excellent work, audibly and story-wise this song is perfect. However, the placement in the TV show is horrendous and should be reviewed. Many songs are like this. Just spontaneous and haphazardly in as if the writer had these songs and just wanted to jam them in there. I think "Respectless" and "You Didn't Know" were some of the only songs that were amazingly placed, as both of these songs made sense with the scene and the events that were going on around it.

It felt rushed

In my personal opinion the series could have done well with season 1 being split between 2 seasons with extra story added in, with the season finale of season 1 being heaven saying screw you we are killing your people, and season 2 being heaven fighting and being defeated/succeeding over hell. With this, we would have extra content and the story would slow down quite a bit and not feel rushed.

The Rating 

If you were to ask me on my first watch-through of this show, I would have given it a high score because it was thrilling to watch and had me captivated, the songs were amazing, and the characters were, and still are loveable. On the surface, I could understand the series as a whole. However, on my 2nd and 3rd watch throughs, I found more issues with the series, and finally, on my final watch-through, my review turned from a high rating to a low rating claiming that a lot of this was more eye candy than creative writing as the story failed to hold up continuity and the pacing was all over the place.
